parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma3

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.70

</value></part><part><name>gr1 </name>=<value> Multiplayer

</value></part><part><name>serverExec</name>=<value> server

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> This is dedicated server command, which queries the admin state of any client on the network by their client ([[owner]]) id. Possible results are:
* <tt>1</tt> - client is admin that is [[server.cfg#Voted_In_Admin|voted in]]
* <tt>2</tt> - client is admin that is [[server.cfg#Logged_In_Admin|logged in]]
In all other cases it returns 0. To self check the admin state of a local client, use [[BIS_fnc_admin]].

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> '''admin''' ownerID

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> ownerID: [[Number]] - [[clientOwner]] id

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Number]] - admin state of given client:
* 0 - client is not an admin
* 1 - client is admin that is voted in
* 2 - client is admin that is logged in

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_isLoggedInAdmin = [[admin]] 3 == 2;</code>
</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>_adminState = [[admin]] [[owner]] unit1;</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[serverCommand]], [[serverCommandAvailable]], [[owner]], [[clientOwner]], [[remoteExecutedOwner]]
</value></part></template></root>
